name: Hotel des Balances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a superb hotel in a stunning Swiss town. We loved our first stay there three years ago and this time it was not only as good as we remembered but having a room with a river/mountain view and eating in the hotel twice (including New Year's Eve) was a culinary experience not to be forgotten) and meant that this stay surpassed the first one. Watching the New Year's fireworks over the lake from our balcony with the church bells ringing all around us will be a longlasting memory.
reviews.title: A second stay and even better than the first...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff are charming (find it hard to believe the negative comments in another recent review), the rooms are tastefully decorated and furnished, spotlessly clean and there are delightful touches (such as the chocolate on the bed each evening). The breakfast will set you up for the day; the choice and the quality are amazing. We wished we were staying for longer just to give us the chance to try all the different breads available!
reviews.title: Elegant hotel in a Charming City!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are already planning the next stay!
reviews.title: Great location. Indifferent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you enter the hotel, you see that the exterior is covered with gorgeous murals from 600+ years ago. The location is perfect, right next to the river. We had a suite facing the river and the view was really beautiful. On New Year's Eve and Day, we were able to watch the fireworks while sitting on our balcony.
reviews.title: The view, the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. To our surprise, they graciously allowed a late check-out without charging us.
reviews.title: Amazing!!
Absolutely great!
reviews.text: For us, this has been one of the greatest hotel experiences ever.

likes.liked: — Desing, location and brand new bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: We were one of the first guests after the hotel has been closed for a total renovation of all bathrooms and the majority of rooms. Besides some final cleaning efforts in the corridors, the we felt very much at home from the first moment. Everything was brand new and it felt like it has just been done for us.
reviews.title: Not impressive and disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are magnificant in modern design but respecting the old architecture. The view from the rooms is fantastic. It didn't really matter to us whether the sun was shining or not. We just enjoyed the room and watching the view.
reviews.title: Pre-Christmas break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is also excellent. We were lucky to get a table at the window and felt like being VIP treated. Btw, they have a very good wine list with affordable prices.
reviews.title: Beautiful Des Balances

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition, hotel staff was very friendly and the breakfast by far exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but the room did not match our expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favourite hotel in Lucerne, especially since it was entirely refurbished some time ago. Others have commented on its unique situation - ask for a river-view room - the friendliness of the staff, the excellent breakfast, the restaurant, the terrace etc., so I would just say that the rooms are great.........once you have worked out the rather complicated lighting arrangements and found out how to run the bath tub (which can be a jaccuzi). The only improvement I could suggest to the owner is the cupboard - it really is too small. There would be ample room to put a bigger one in, or even a second one. A member has complained about midgets - this must be because he/she did not press the button to lower the outside stores. They leave enough light in not to make the room too dark yet allow you to sleep with open windows. Yes, there is no airconditioning, but alas this is very common in Swiss hotels, even top-of-the-range places.
reviews.title: A favourite place to stay
Loved Location but No AirCo
reviews.text: This hotel has an amazing location, right in the centre with a lot of the rooms having a river view with balcony, my only criticism is that when we looked for air conditioning, we found a hand held fan in the cupboard. In the middle of August, this did no good at all. The rooms got so hot during the day, it was impossible to cool the room down at night, even leaving all balcony doors and windows open all night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An ideal hotel for a stay in Luzern. The location is central for all facilities from the old town and its pedestrian zone to just five minute stroll to the whole travel network, be it boat, train or bus. The reception staff were always pleasant and reserved us our table in the restaurant on a paddle steamer travelling the length of Lake Luzern. The Maitre De was very helpful when dining in the restaurant but be careful because they may try to locate guests in the overspill area during busy periods. The food was first class quality and we were able to vary items on the menu to suite our particular taste.
reviews.title: IDEAL HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our bedroom , on the fourth floor, gave a wonderful view of the snow capped mountains, well furnished and efficiently serviced. The coffee/tea facility unusual for a continental hotel was regularly maintained.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent seven days at the hotel and we pleased with all aspects and should we return to Luzern would not hesitate to use them again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Old Town Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading T A. We were very pleased from the word go. Our sons were upgraded to a river view, which we had booked for ourselves. The staff were all relaly helpful and friendly and the rooms are lovely. We had great meals and the position is very convenient, as well as being beautiful. Free WiFi topped it for the teenagers. Lucerne is lovely and we would have liked to have stayed an extra night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with 1st class food, rooms, location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will take delight in the outstanding location of this great little hotel. Arrive Lucerne by train and take a short 10 minute walk by the river and across the Chapel Bridge! Everything is very close... shopping, sights and great food. Enjoy a great meal in the front of the hotel in the plaza of fabulous risotto and listen to the beauty of the alpine horn. The rooms are always spotless... ask for a river view and watch the swans glide by.
reviews.title: A great place near the lake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel des Balences is probably one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. my husband and I were upgraded to a river facing suite and it was amazing. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was beautiful.
reviews.title: Made our holiday - should have stayed longer!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We unfortunately only stayed there one night and loved every minute - hope to go back soon....
reviews.title: Dramatic views, convenient location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful experience at his hotel. The views from our balcony overlooked the river and the historic bridge against the backdrop of interesting church siloettes and Mount Pilatus in the distance. The bed was comfortable with top quality bedding, the bathroom was modern with great water pressue and immaculately clean. The WIFI worked well. We found the staff very accomodating. When we saw our view we decided to stay put and my huisband went down to the bar for drinks and munchies. The bar tender set him up with drinks on a silver tray and nuts and chips and held the door open for him and then the elevator door as well. My husband was very happy!! The balcony seats and table were clean and comfortable...not always the case. We could have stayed out there all day! The room was quiet at night and very relaxing.
reviews.title: Great location but......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took some time searching the town for a hotel which had a view
reviews.title: Wonderful position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: but dismissed the lakefront hotels on grounds of both cost and traffic noise. We were delighted to discover Des Balances in the centre of the old town, and although it is in a pedestrian area we were able to park our car right outside the hotel. This is a historic hotel which has been completely modernised inside, with very well equipped rooms . The staff took great trouble to give us a suitable room with a balcony overlooking the river with views of the lake and mountains (room 104), which was spacious with a beautiful bathroom.
reviews.title: Stay at des Balances
Great Restaurant. Our room was poor value though.
reviews.text: The restaurant offered inside or terrace dining, both very pleasant and the food was excellent on both the evenings we were there. Buffet breakfast, which was included in our room rate ,was also extremely good. Free internet access in the lounge. We highly recommend this lovely hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at des Balances for our 10th anniversary. We were as pleased with this visit as we were with our first one three years ago. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk away from the train station, right on the river. The train ride from Zurich airport takes less than an hour. A taxi with our luggage cost 20 CHF so we walked on our way back! Check in was smooth and the staff were very pleasant - the only unusual thing was no one asked to assist us with our luggage.
reviews.title: Location is the reason to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a beautiful junior suite with a river view (Rm 103). It was very large and immaculate, with modern furnishings and wood floors. There was a large bathtub/whirlpool in the room itself, with a separate shower and toilet. There was a large balcony with a small table - the view was simply spectacular. The town, river and Mount Pilatus were clearly visible.
reviews.title: Great spot by the river, but obvious why the hotel only has 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a river view room and found it exactly as expected - after reading all the tripadvisor reviews.
reviews.title: Exactly as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: One thing that was not expected was that on a couple of days it was quite warm mid 20's and was not cold at night. The room was a little warm and if you left the windows open the 'midges' flew in. There is no air-conditioning.
reviews.title: A Truly Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — The fabulous location, views, and the sensational restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On balance we enjoyed the experience and depending on the time of year would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location, great history, wonderful staff and nice breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel des Balances in Luzern is a fantastic option for a stay in this wonderful city. It is located a stone's throw away from the old town and sights such as the Kappelbrücke and the Jesuitenkirche. It takes about 10 minutes to walk from the station. The façade is a tourist attraction in its own right! The hotel has a really elegant character inside. The reception area is very nice and airy. There is a lovely lounge area adjacent, which has views over the river and a balcony. The check-in was hassle-free and friendly. The room was lovely, and was very large. We had a town view room, which was lovely and quiet. The beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom is very clean and spacious with all the necessary amenities. However, the restaurant is what really makes the experience special. It has a perfect setting, right by the river, and you can have breakfast with magnificent views of the Kappelbrücke! The buffet is very extensive, and of excellent quality. For dinner, the restaurant's offerings are truly sensational. I would recommend the "Amuse-Bouche" 7-course menu. It features contemporary food with a Swiss style.
reviews.title: Comfortable room with a stunning view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a number 1 choice out of all hotels in Luzern - I will definitely go back!
reviews.title: We just love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent the weekend of 12-7 in Luzerne. We LOVED Des Balances. The location is perfect. It's an easy walk from the train station even with bags and a 3 year old. I had requested a room with the best view and we got it. We were on the top floor and had a huge balcony. My son had plenty of room to play in the snow on it, was super.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very helpful in making dinner reservations for us and helping with sightseeing recommendations. Very professional. The welcome drink was a bonus and yummy. I chose the apple strudel martini-excellent.
reviews.title: Great service and pretty rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good and they make eggs to order included.
reviews.title: A special place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to say anything negative it would be that the room was slightly smaller than I hoped for. However, all of the luxuries and the location more than made up for that.
reviews.title: Great second visit...but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great trip and I would stay again without a doubt.
reviews.title: Great location and exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had just one night at this beautiful hotel in this beautiful town before we flew home from Zurich. So sad. But we will return and be sure to stay at Des Balances.
reviews.title: If only we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Never mind that the GPS kept trying to have us drive into the river, when we relinquished to car to the attendant, we knew we had arrived at the right place.Right on the edge of Old Town and River, the hotel is perfectly situated. The views from the room are outstanding. The staff is warm, friendly and helpful!Our room was large and a good balance between old world and modern. New conveniences and updated bathrooms. The linens and towels are top quality.
reviews.title: A lovely experience
Best hotel I've stayed in!
reviews.text: Breakfast was worth the trip in itself. Beautiful presentation and preparation. The welcome drink is an appreciated touch. Next time we will be sure dine at the hotel restaurant for dinner.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a short but wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Beautiful views, perfect location, decadent rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly located in the old town and on the lake. The staff upgraded me to a lake view without me asking-nice touch. The L'Occitane gift bags each morning were a lovely touch as was the welcome drink and nibbles in the room. The staff were most helpful in providing information on local attractions. I would love to stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect Location. Excellent Hotel.

description: The Hotel Des Balances - a four star superior property – is located in the beautiful heart of Lucerne’s Old Town. The ideal starting point for shopping and sight seeing.It has 56 tastefully renovated rooms and suites with a view of the famous Chapel Bridge, Jesuit Church and Mount Pilatus.Enjoy market fresh creations in our Restaurant Balances with lounge, bar and terrace directly at the river Reuss. 14 Gault Millau points stand for culinary art.Individual premises impressively combine tradition and modern comfort and provide the perfect framework for your unique event.Treat yourself to insBrational moments at the Hotel des Balances.
